title: Y3shot
author: Y3shot
created_time: July 11, 2024, 09:58:21 AMLast edit: July 11, 2024, 12:06:09 PM by Y3shot
content: Santa Monica is opening an official bitcoin office, the reason for this opening is to provide bitcoin education and search potential economic opportunities.  The office has four main goals. 1. Providing bitcoin education.2. Facilitating partnerships and conferences to grow tourism.3. Connect residents to jobs.4. Exploring sustainable bitcoin mining power by the City's renewable energy. Santa Monica is emulating the footsteps of El Salvador, because El Salvador has opened a bitcoin office and much engaged to significant investment and tourism related to bitcoin. Some other recent bitcoin developments in santa Monica include firefighters adopting self-custody of bitcoin and City leader visiting El Salvador to study its bitcoin adoption.  https://bitcoinmagazine.com/business/the-city-of-santa-monica-is-opening-a-bitcoin-office?utm_source=carrot&utm_medium=partner&utm_campaign=carrot_share

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I've looked at Santa Monica's economy to understand their decision better. One of the leading economic sectors is “Silicon Beach”, so primarily Technology. Another major sector is tourism, generating nearly 1 billion dollars annually for the local economy. So, with a focus on technology and significant tourism, it sounds smart to open a Bitcoin office there. It can be of interest to tech companies, and it can also become a tourist attraction. Their unemployment rate isn't high (6%), so I'm not sure whether they particularly need to improve that area, but growing revenue never hurts.I'd say it's a big jump from here to 'emulating El Salvador', a country that accepts Bitcoin as legal tender, but it is still a positive development for people living there or visiting that place.

comments.body: Quote from: tabas on July 11, 2024, 11:05:49 AMSo, it's Santa Monica which is located in California, in the US. Well, any place that's going to do so is definitely going to do it for the attraction and as well as education. I do wish them to have a good progress with this. I guess instead of calling it as a bitcoin office, they should call it as a Bitcoin center.I think that it is not proper for the city of Santa Monica, to name the place where people can be informed about Bitcoin, a Bitcoin office. It sounds like a Bitcoin centralized office, the name can be misleading for some people to think that Bitcoin now has a physical offices, it should have been called a Bitcoin center. Since the city generates it's income from tourism, I think that it is a step in the right direction for them to have the Bitcoin office or center to educate people about Bitcoin and how it can promote tourism in their city. Other cities should emulate them and have these Bitcoin centers to educate people and increase it's adoption.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Opening of a Bitcoin office doesn't bring anything on the plate except a little hope! Also we are not sure behind the intention of having such department. Unless that country declares Bitcoin as a legal tender, there's no reason to cheer yet!

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: Y3shot on July 11, 2024, 09:58:21 AMSanta Monica is opening an official bitcoin office,I just finished watching the Bitcoin-related parts of their "July 9th council meeting" and noticed Vice Mayor Negrete explicitly mentioned this is not going to be "a specific physical office... It is opportunities that we will be hosting at maybe public spaces like our library or whatnot [6:56:51]". A few council members were worried if this so-called Bitcoin office was going to give investment advice with their city logo being in the picture, so they were asking for insurance stuff, but since none of these are part of its goals, no one opposed it.Bitcoin-related timeline:One of the speakers [not a council member] labeled it as a scam [2:18:16 to 2:19:24]Other speakers [2:30:05 to 2:48:37]
